function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Shift to unhealthy processed food consumption due to lack of nutritional guidelines for food parcels to the poor.","Impact":"Increased risk of malnutrition and chronic conditions such as obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease.","Mitigation":"Implement nutritional guidelines for food parcels and educate on the importance of healthy eating. Provide access to fresh food supplies for lower-income households.","Technologies":"Nutritional tracking apps, online nutritional education platforms, food delivery services.","People":"Lower-income households, children from households that depend on school-feeding programmes, vulnerable populations.","Owner":"Government agencies, non-profit organizations, community leaders."},{"Description":"Interrupted access to food for children from households that depend on school-feeding programmes due to school closures.","Impact":"Increased financial burden and household food insecurity.","Mitigation":"Implement alternative food distribution programs, such as home delivery or community pick-up points. Provide financial support to families to purchase food.","Technologies":"Food delivery apps, online payment systems, community food distribution platforms.","People":"Children from low-income households, families relying on school-feeding programmes.","Owner":"School administrations, government agencies, non-profit organizations."},{"Description":"Staggering loss of jobs and livelihoods leading to financial challenges in affording healthy foods.","Impact":"Increased food insecurity and risk of malnutrition for individuals and families.","Mitigation":"Create employment support programs, financial assistance for food purchases, and subsidize healthy food options. Implement community food support initiatives.","Technologies":"Job search platforms, digital financial assistance systems, community food donation platforms.","People":"Individuals and families facing job loss and financial challenges.","Owner":"Government agencies, employers, non-profit organizations."},{"Description":"Disruption of routine physical activity due to stay-at-home orders and curfew measures.","Impact":"Reduced physical activity and increased risk of chronic conditions such as obesity and cardiovascular disease.","Mitigation":"Promote at-home and online physical activity programs, provide guidance on safe outdoor exercise, and encourage active lifestyle choices.","Technologies":"Fitness apps, online workout programs, wearable activity trackers.","People":"Individuals affected by stay-at-home orders and curfew measures.","Owner":"Public health agencies, fitness organizations, community leaders."}]}
